results.title: A Child is born
results.brief_description: Traces the relationship between a young wife and her husband from the time that they decide to have children to the birth and homecoming of their first child. Shows the development of the foetus using live photography and the actual birth of the child, capturing the blend of pain and joy in life’s most miraculous moment. Adapted from the film “Barnet (the child)” produced by Skandia Insurance Company, Stockholm. Narrated by Mary S. Caldesone.

results.title: A Continuing responsibility
results.creator_credit: Bonnie Sherr Klein, Barrie Howells, John Kemeny and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Produced as part of the Challenge for Change Program, this series examines Saul Alinsky’s method of organising communities into effective action units based on participation democracy. As demonstrated in the Woodland Organisation in Chicago, Alinsky’s technique creates ongoing organisations firmly rooted in the community.

results.title: A Computer glossary, or, coming to terms with the data processing machine
results.creator_credit: Ray Eames, Charles Eames, Richard Spies, Bill Lightfield and IBM
results.brief_description: Beginning with a journey along a computer data path, this films uses a variety of visual techniques to illustrate terms such as software, program, flow, subroutine, mnemonic, language, boolean logic, nanosecond, simulation, pattern recognition and algorithm. Emphasises the challenge of computer programming that emerges from its precisely defined procedures. Music by Elmer Bernstein.

results.title: A Company of Men
results.creator_credit: Fred Moore, Leon Clore and Basic Films
results.brief_description: Focuses attention on the more delicate question of the prejudices and resistance which may be encountered at all levels when Work Study is introduced into industry. The story is based on the day-to-day record of a six-months period in an engineering firm in the Midlands, and is presented as a realistic account of the difficulties experienced and overcome, in an effort to bring fundamental problems into open discussion.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fred Moore, Leon Clore and Basic Films

results.title: A Collection of carols
results.creator_credit: William Forest Crouch and New Official Films
results.brief_description: Come all ye faithful; “The First Noel”; “It Came upon a midnight clear”; “Joy to the world”; “Hark! The Herald angels’ sing”; “Silent night”. A gang of morose adolescent boys besiege the doors of a church, overhead, a radioactive space baby illuminates the night sky. Drawings detail the unsavoury habits of certain rural communities as shepherds obscenely fondle their ward and throughout a vigorous stentorian choir sings hymns of praise.

results.title: A Class Divided
results.creator_credit: William Peters and WGBH Educational Foundation
results.brief_description: Jane Elliott divided her classroom into blue-eyed and brown-eyed children to teach them the degrading effects of discrimination. “A Class Divided” shows the result of her teaching on the adults who took her class as children in the 1960’s. Her teaching method was so successful that it has been used as a basis for training workshops on racism within the US prison system, and is used by business companies to expose racist attitudes amongst employees and employers. Elliott herself says that the “necessity for this exercise is a crime. But I think this exercise ought to be taught by every teacher.”

results.title: A Chance to learn
results.creator_credit: Fred Moore, Leon Clore, British Productivity Council and Basic Films
results.brief_description: The advantages gained by industry from a systematic training of operators. A middle-aged woman, discontented because the personnel officer regards training as an expensive gimmick, takes another job where, given the chance to learn, her whole attitude changes. A small garment factory adopts a training program which becomes an indispensable part of normal activities.

results.title: A City reborn
results.creator_credit: Peter Reinshagen and Victor Gruen Associates
results.brief_description: Illustrates good city planning, showing how Fresno, California, has revitalised its city centre by a plan implemented from 1964, diverting traffic from the city core, turning the main street into a long pedestrian mall. Contrasts the success of the plan with the inner city congestion and suburban disorganisation of many cities.

results.title: A Cat is a cat...
results.brief_description: An informative and entertaining animated film narrated by children and set to a Beethoven score. It offers facts about cats and provides insight into animal behaviour. A variety of cat stereotypes are shown. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: A City is
results.creator_credit: James Carney, Barrie Howells and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: More than buildings, more than people, a city is a total expression of purpose and aspiration, past and present. This is a multi-image look at the conglomerate city, composed of a whole stream of visual and auditory impressions presented without commentary. Often the screen subdivides - two, three, a dozen images appear at the same time, creating a counterpoint of the turbulence and discord, the harmony and sophistication of the big city.
